sen.j: 鷹見 泉石（たかみ せんせき、天明5年6月29日 (旧暦)（1785年8月3日） - 安政5年7月16日 (旧暦)（1858年8月24日））は、江戸時代の蘭学者であり、下総国古河藩の家老。
sen.e: Senseki TAKAMI (August 3, 1785 to August 24,1858) was a Dutch scholar (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) in Edo period, and he was a principal retainer in the Koga clan of Shimousa Province.

sen.j: 1797年、調役給仕として出仕して以降、目付、用人上席、番頭格などを経、1831年には280石の家老（役高500石）に昇進した。
sen.e: After his serving as an investigator in 1797, he became inspector of foot soldiers, superior lord chamberlain, head clerk, etc, and got promoted to the chief retainer of 280 Koku of crop yield (high post 500 Koku) in 1831.

Starting to serve as shirabeyaku kyuji (investigating assistant) in the domain in 1797, he served in a variety of posts including metsuke (inspector of foot soldiers), yonin joseki (senior officer handling domestic economy), bantokaku (head of security guard) and got promoted to karo (chief retainer) with 280 Koku of crop yield (500 Koku paid for his post) in 1831.

sen.j: 烏帽子と服は線描を使った東洋の伝統的な画法、相貌は西洋の陰影法や彩色法を使うという対照的な技法を用いながら、全く違和感なく融合させ人物の内面まで感じさせる高い完成度をもつ。
sen.e: While he was using the Oriental traditional painting technique of outlining the black-lacquered headgear (formal headwear for court nobles) and clothes, and the western coloring technique and shading technique of the face together, his work had a high level of completion revealing the inside character of the person without any feeling of incompatibility of Oriental and Western styles.

Blending two different painting style perfectly - the Oriental traditional painting one using drawing technique for describing eboshi (formal headwear for court nobles) and clothes and the Western style of shadowing and coloring methods for describing facial expression - succeeded in producing a high-quality picture that also expressed the inside of the character.
